website_summaries.verdict: The PIG is heavy-duty and inexpensive. If you ride a mountain bike or your bike will take a beating over the years, we highly recommend investing in this quality bike headset.
cons: While the PIG’s inherent bulk reinforces the headset’s longevity, some may not appreciate its thickness

customer_reviews.title: edit!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good fsa headset but not the "pig" headset. not manufacturers fault, it's the sellers fault for false advertising. Amazon should do something about this seller. The FSA headset is good stuff but not the one seller claims. I should have known by the price.I was wrong, just went to fsa website and this is the big pig. There is another called the big fat pig, maybe that's where amazon got the picture. The pig graphic isn't on the big pig. Also MSRP is $27.99 so price is actually good for this exact model.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: well crafted but heavy. beefy for tandems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 'PIG' for my tandem. the bearings it replaced looked like BB's! the Bearings on the FSA pig are hardy and large on the bottom and smaller on the top where there is less stress. this IS a heavy set but well made. tandems ,downhillers, and heavy load bike will benefit. lighter bikes should look elsewhere IMO.
customer_reviews.author: crabtrap

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty headset
customer_reviews.text: Like others have noted, mine also lacks the graphics in the product images. Legit or not, it installs easily, there's no slop in the bearings, yet it's smooth. I'm a clyde and this is installed on a heavy ebike with a 12 pound hub motor on the front and hydraulic 203mm brakes, so I'm stressing this headset more than most. So far I only have about 30 miles on the new headset, but I'll update this review occasionally whether anything changes or not.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade for Mongoose Dolomite
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers mentioned, it does not state "The Pig" anywhere on it but it does not matter to me since I followed a YouTube link on a recommended item. It is a FSA product. The factory bearings from my Dolomite were garbage. Rarely rode the bike but the front fork was very loose because of this. Installation was easy even without the recommended tools. Would buy again. Highly recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ATX

customer_reviews.title: great headset.
customer_reviews.text: upgraded a walmart mongoose fat bike. this headset is much stronger than the stock one.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H.

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Great for what it is. That being, a heavy-duty no-frills headset at a reasonable price. It works just fine on my Surly Crosscheck set up for touring. No wear issues after a year of regular commuting with about 20 lbs of gear and 270 lbs of me on the bike. Note that you're going to need a headset press (not a hammer) to install this little beast.
customer_reviews.author: Joel A. Soukup

customer_reviews.title: Smooth.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Direct replacement for the stock headset in my Mongoose Dolomite. Had it on for around a month now and it's a marked improvement from the stock headset. Make sure you have or have access to a headset cup removal tool and a crown race remover.
customer_reviews.author: Luke M.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Mine did not have "The Pig" on it either. But I had a local bike shop install, and it has made a world of a difference for my mongoose dolomite. Very happy with this product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Roddy

customer_reviews.title: Not "THE PIG"
customer_reviews.text: still a good headset upgrade for your stock mid to low end bike headsets. i had doubts it would actually be an fsa the pig headset at the price, which i was right. I would prefer honest product description and pictures!
customer_reviews.author: alfonso

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item after reviewing other reviews and was happy with the item. The only issue I have is I didn't need all the parts so I paid for extras pieces I don't need.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: GYRO compatible! Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Needed as replacement for stock headset that was not gyro compatible. Nice smooth action, easy to instal. Awesome item for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: How to upgrade your steering.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I never though a headset could change things. This is absolutely an upgrade to most bike builds. Beefier and stronger. You need to set into place correctly and make sure you have the right bearings in the right orientation, but you will *not* be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Without a doubt "the PIG" is tough
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a BEAST! The lower bearing is over twice the size of stock. It's built to take a beating. It was easy to install and works flawlessly. I would definitely purchase FSA Products again,well worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: jeffery swartwood

customer_reviews.title: Not "the pig"
customer_reviews.text: You will not receive "The Pig" headset, it will be a cheaper, older, larger model FSA headset.
customer_reviews.author: Seana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Came a day ahead of schedule and works great will buy for my other fat bike
customer_reviews.author: David lynch

customer_reviews.title: Product is not as advertised !
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what kind of headset this is but it is not The PIG. Don't have time to return have to install and race. If its a dud I'm definitely not buying from this seller again and just might stay away from FSA from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Moreno

customer_reviews.title: No money back, I want my quality product please.
customer_reviews.text: I was so anxious to get this. And so disappointed it was lost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Does What it is Supposed To
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this due to changing my bike's fork. Thought, "I might as well do this too". There is no noticeable improvement in steering smoothness or anything. The bearings are bigger than the ones that came on my diamondback. I am thinking that is a plus. I have had this for a couple of months now, and still have had no issues with it. Overall, if you need to change yours out, this one is pretty good. Otherwise, I would just wait until the one you have is no longer any good.
customer_reviews.author: OverAmbitious

customer_reviews.title: Good, entry level, heavy duty headset.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty loose bearings in a carrier. Everything is well machined and smooth. If you want a sealed cartridge, this is not your headset. But, the price is good, and it's designed to take a lot of abuse and grit.
customer_reviews.author: Josh (Xaminmo) Davis

customer_reviews.title: This thing looks really strong with it's 1/4 lower ball ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks really strong with it's 1/4 lower ball bearings and the tapered compression ring is made of aluminum which I haven't seen before as they are always plastic. After destroying many headsets on drift trikes this one looks very promising.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron g.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly. Instructions could be clearer, but there are many many youtube tutorials about changing out headset bearings.
customer_reviews.author: Msilver

customer_reviews.title: but it's much cheaper and so far I'm very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty looking, smooth enough so far. Wish it was a sealed cartridge style, but it's much cheaper and so far I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: joel goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable replacement headset
customer_reviews.text: I rebuild bikes for a hobby, these headsets are an affordable, reliable, replacement.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This was a less expensive alternative that a friend told me to try. I love the larger lower bearings. I believe it will serve me well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This headset is a well-built product and I would buy another. I haven't used it long enough to speak for its durability but so far, so good. It is a smooth operating headset!
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Lanhart

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, heavy, durable as f@#k. What more do you need?
customer_reviews.author: christopher j broughton

customer_reviews.title: Solid strong, maybe not the real deal !?
customer_reviews.text: Im really happy with this headset bearing and the races are really burly. Unfortunately I thought I was getting the fat pig authentic set, not the sorta fat pig Burly set , whatever... Either way its working, takes an abuse, and hasn't failed in 2000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for the money
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Heave as hell though. Wish I'd spend a few dollars more for something that wasn't a boat anchor.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: pretty cool looking
customer_reviews.text: First headset I ever purchased and it made my bike look cool and different. You can also just feel the difference between this headset and a stock one as this is much more quality.
customer_reviews.author: Albiery Carpio

customer_reviews.title: Much better than stock.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my new mongoose malus fat tire bike. It’s much bigger and stronger than the original. Bearings are much better too. It doesn’t match the picture and doesn’t have the pig insignia on it but definitely will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: jim luzzi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered "the pig" and recieved a standard fsa. However, it is still of high quality and better than anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: Was not "handed to a resident"
customer_reviews.text: Product was not "handed to a resident" as said in delivery, and the product was missing the top cup bearings... luckily had an extra bearing to make it function... aside from that, all good
customer_reviews.author: Roy L

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy headset. I like that the bottom bearings are ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy headset. I like that the bottom bearings are oversized. This was my first headset install and it went easy. The top on mine was flat instead of domed as the picture shows, however this has nothing to do with function, and the appearance of the flat top is just as good as the domed. For a 1-1/8 headset that doesn't cost too much, you can't beat this one.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: FSA THE PIG
customer_reviews.text: The headset is amazing. when i got an email saying it shipped, it came in just 2 days(which is super fast). I put this headset on my razor ultra pro's threaded forks, because thread-less headsets can go on threaded forks(because thread-less forks are crazy money). It does stick out on the sides more than my other headset, which is why i think its called "THE PIG" Thanks FSA for another great product!
customer_reviews.author: strawbz1029

product_meta.title: FSA The Pig Headset
product_meta.description: FSA's The Pig headset is one tough customer. With forged and CNC machined CrMo cups and oversized 1/4" bearings in the lower cup, this headset will not let you down.
feature_bullets: With Forged And Cnc Machined Crmo Cups And Oversized 1/4 Inch Bearings In The Lower Cup, This Headset Will Not Let You Down
Fsa Sl-K Rnumxrnumt Stem Was Constructed To Provide Rigid Support For The Handlebars, Feeling Similar In Both Weight And Stiffness
Package Dimensions: 2.4" ( H ) x 2.3" ( L ) x 2.3" ( W )

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
